ygData.subject: Re: Humble youth seeking enlightenemt
ygData.msgSnippet: For all of you interested in the math, the lack of importance between levels in groups for high level characters makes sense: Take the 2 cases mentioned, the
ygData.messageBody:
For all of you interested in the math, the lack of importance between levels
in groups for high level characters makes sense:
Take the 2 cases mentioned, the first with a lvl 20 and a lvl 24.
The lower lvl char is getting 20/44 = 45.5% of the exp, the higher char
24/44 = 54.5%.
In the second case, a lvl 6 with a lvl 10 we get:
6/16 = 37.5% for the lower lvl char and
10/16 = 62.5% for the higher lvl char
So if you look at these numers it makes a LOT of sense that the difference
in levels isn't as significant as you get into the mid 20's and higher.
I apologize if this is boring for some of you...I thought it was interesting
:)
Sean
> There are also some unknown tweak factors or somesuch in
>effect behind the scenes that make grouping work better between
>disparate level characters at higher levels (like 20+, etc...). There
>is less of an XP result difference between a 20 and 24 grouped pair
>than between a 6 and 10 grouped pair.
